statement:
Assume $n  \geq 2$ is an integer and that $P$ is a polynomial with
coefficients in $\{0,1,\ldots,n-1\}$. If $P(n)$ is prime then $P(x)$ is
in $\mathbb{Z}[x]$.

A proof is given in [@MRM].

A. Cohn [@PZ] proved this theorem for the case $n=10$.

This special case of the above theorem is sketched as problem 128, Part
VIII, in [@PZ].
